label: Perrin de Gaudoux
notes: PG messes things up totally when she refers "cf. Belis" under Gaudoux (de) Perrin, and when under Perrin without surname she refers to different Perrin as if they were the same. I went through all the references to P. Belis and P. de Gaudoux. They are different people (at p. 931 and 1049, they are cited both by the deponent, which is a clear proof). Perrin de Gaudoux is said to be cleric (p. 1021, 1489), and so just as PG, I assimilate the mentions of Perrin the cleric without surname under Perrin de Gaudoux (which is p. 1025, 1045, 1063, 1075, 1079, 1541, 1543). Problematic is Perrin without specification, which is p. 989 (here I adopt the conjecture that at p. 989 it is P. de Gaudoux; he accompanies Chrétien here but in fact both Belis and Gaudoux do), 1041 (but here, the same deponent enumerates the Waldenses he knows at 1043, and there it is Perrin de Gaudoux, so the identification is plausible), and also Perrin Wudri who teaches and walks with Guillaume Motier at p. 1013; Wudri is really his other surname (identity proven by p. 1581). Because his father is named Wudri de Gaudone (p. 1128), i.e. Wudri is the first name, Wudri is probably a form of Audry.
